action.action-desc: Mrs. Bice (for herself, Mr. Newhouse, Mr. Johnson of South Dakota, and Mr. Carter of Georgia) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to prohibit the Securities and Exchange Commission from requiring an issuer to make climate-related disclosures that are not material to investors, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stop Environmental Calculations Act of 2023 or the SEC Act of 2023.

section.header: Prohibition on requiring an issuer to make climate-related disclosures that are not material to investors
section.text: Section 23 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (15 U.S.C. 78w) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Prohibition on requiring an issuer To make climate-Related disclosures that are not material to investors
subsection.text: The Commission may not require an issuer to make climate-related disclosures that are not material to investors.
